events.name: Using R through User Interfaces: Rattle and Azure ML
events.description: Dear all,  Our next session should be very interesting; it will be conducted by data scientists from Microsoft: 1. Graham Williams, Director of Data Science, Microsoft 2. Zhou Fang, Data Scientist, Microsoft Here is the agenda: 6:30 pm-7:00 pm: IT set up, registration, food enjoyment, networking 7:00 pm – 8:00 pm: Graham Williams, Director of Data Science, Microsoft Data Mining with Rattle and R Data Scientists and Data Miners often build classification models using a variety of algorithms available in R. The open source Rattle package for R (http://rattle.togaware.com/ ) was developed to allow anyone to quickly build such models. In this session the author of Rattle will introduce Data Mining using Rattle, hands-on. 8:00 pm – 8:15 pm: Networking and Refreshment Break 8:15 pm – 9:00 pm: Fang Zhou, Data Scientist, Microsoft Azure Machine Learning with R Machine learning workflow, introduce Azure ML studio (https://studio.azureml.net/ ) and demonstrate on customer churn prediction, highlight the usage of R from Azure ML and Power BI. 9:00 pm – 9:30 pm: Lab, Graham & Fang Or 9:00 pm – 9:15 pm: Wrap-up, Graham See you all then! Vik
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: Build Compelling Apps with Google's Machine Learning and Firebase
events.description: Google is hosting a talk on Machine Learning and Firebase to educate the community about it's merits and how it can improve your apps and services on June 22; 18:30 hrs at Blk 71. App Developers (front end and back end), product managers, and business owners will benefit from this talk. Machine Learning is heavily adopted in Fintech and e-Commerce platforms already. Registration Closed as it's full ! https://events.withgoogle.com/build-compelling-apps-with-googles-machine-learning-and-firebase/
events.group_name: Google Cloud Platform User Group Singapore

events.name: AWSUG June Meetup
events.description: I'm pleased to announce that we will be holding our next AWS User Group meetup here in the AWS Singapore office on Weds, 22-June. Expect a similar format to the last couple of meetups, we will be hosting here in the AWS Singapore office again, kicking off at ~7pm, Pizza and refreshments will be served. Talks will begin at 1915. We aim to keep them short at no more than 20 minutes each with Q&A at the end.  AGENDA: Honestbee (Vincent De Smet) Vincent will be giving an overview of the development process of an application with Docker for Mac and deploying to ECS.  Kumolus (Michael Salleo) Michael is the CTO and Founder – of the cloud management platform Kumolus. Kumolus helps organisations like Symantec, Monash University and Indusface to manage, automate and control their cloud environments.  Michael will give an overview and run through of Kumolus' features and uses. Love, Bonito (Wayne Khan) Love, Bonito is a women's fashion brand known for construction, fit, finish & value. We strive to inspire and dress the women of today to be the change for tomorrow. We've been hard at work making a name for ourselves online here in Singapore and Indonesia, plus flagship store up in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Wayne is a dev. with full stack experience with a penchant for shipping awesome products and features for the web. His other interests include system and database administration, and he's also functioned as product manager and successfully delivered software projects for internal and external clients. Wayne will run through the challenges and architecture of Love, Bonito. WHERE:  The AWS Singapore office. https://goo.gl/maps/UzzR2 WHO CAN ATTEND: All are welcome! No prior experience needed. • Anyone who wants to know more about cloud computing and startup companies • Anyone who wants to understand the benefits of cloud computing and how to use the “cloud” to benefit their organization. • Startup founders and aspiring founders COST:  Free! Snacks will be served!
events.location: AWS Offices Singapore, 23 Church Street, Capital Square, #10-01, Singapore - 049481, +65-67220300

events.name: Pre-PyCon PyData Meetup - June 2016 - Algorithmic Trading + Quantopian
events.description: Agenda • 6:45pm - 7:00pm Networking • 7:00pm - 7:55pm Presentation: Pandas for Financial Factor Modeling by Delaney Granizo-Mackenzie Synopsis: A common technique in quantitative finance is that of ranking stocks by using a combination of fundamental factors and price-based signals. Delaney Granizo-Mackenzie, a software engineer at Quantopian, will be presenting an IPython Notebook that explores long-short strategies and fundamental factor models in an application involving US equities. Speaker: Delaney's background is in computer science, math, and statistics. Prior to joining Quantopian, Delaney worked in a bioinformatics lab at Dartmouth researching non-linear genetic interactions. During his time at Quantopian he has facilitated financial engineering workshops in collaboration with professors at MIT, Harvard, Cornell, Stanford, and many other institutions. He curates and interactive online curriculum at https://www.quantopian.com/lectures, and teaches the curriculum at international workshops. Updates • PyCon Singapore 2016 is happening tomorrow!!! See https://pycon.sg/ • New ebooks/videos from O'Reilly! Only for members (who have not requested an ebook yet) attending the session! • Join the NSCC (National Supercomputing Centre Singapore) Hackathon! Solve interesting business problems with supercomputers http://www.nscchackathon.com/ Join us on Facebook and Twitter https://www.facebook.com/groups/pydatasg/https://www.twitter.com/pydatasg Sponsors    Group Sponsor
events.location: Skyscanner, 39 Robinson Road, #09-01 Robinson Point, Singapore 068911

events.name: Migrating to Kubernetes + Docker
events.description:
This talk is structured as follows:  1) Introduction to a containerised deployment using a traditional backend architecture as a base  2) Introducing basic deployment with just docker  3) Deeper introduction to Docker and what it does  4) Problems & incoveniences with just a docker deployment  5) Kubernetes as a docker (container) orchestration platform  6) Deployment with kubernetes  7) Deeper introduction to kubernetes / 8)Kubernetes >> Docker orchestration. An example of using k8s as a distributed systems framework  9) Introduction to Hasura  Each point will use a live-demo (or a recorded session as backup) and will then have 2-3 backing slides on salient points. This will NOT be a theory talk. It will be a demo-driven talk. 


About the speaker:  Tanmai is a Bachelors & Masters graduate in Computer Science from the Indian Institute of Technology Madras. Although originally specialising in Computer Vision, Tanmai has gradually moved his area of expertise to Software Engineering, DevOps & functional/reactive programming in the cloud/web application space. He has spearheaded 'immutable infrastructure' & functional programming efforts (both server/client side) at Hasura & 34 Cross. He is currently CTO at Hasura. 



About Hasura: Hasura is a platform for building scalable application backends, while retaining complete control. With out of the box APIs for database, search, authentication, etc., Hasura minimises the time taken to build your application backend. It is built on top of Kubernetes, Docker, CoreOS and is designed to be run anywhere; from a dev machine to a bare metal environment; a single node to a cluster; our most recent instant deployment was on a VMWare cluster for a payment wallet startup in India.  This PaaS + BaaS solution arose out of the very real need of having to build applications rapidly and then having to maintain them (like Django & RoR). Hasura puts together all the best platform components along with the best application components like PostgresQL, Redis, Nginx and glues everything together to create a seamless, yet open experience for the developer.

events.name: All About 3D Printing
events.description:
3D Printing is synonymous with modern cutting edge technology of the 21st century. However, did you know that its origin can be traced back 30 years ago to the 1980s? Advancement of technology and lower costs of materials have made 3D printing something that everyone can tap on. In this workshop, we will be introducing participants to what 3D printing is about and the different materials that they can use with 3D printing. Learn the tips and tricks for 3D printing and acquire valuable insights into maintenance for your 3D printers.

You will learn:
- To understand what is Digital Fabrication
- Conventional Manufacturing vs Additive Manufacturing
- 3D Printing Technologies – FDM, SLS and SLA
- Features of typical desktop / small scale commercial 3D printers
- Types of materials available for DIY 3D printing
- Slicing, Infill, Supports, Placement Direction and other print parameters
- 3D printing consumables / service vendors in Singapore and beyond
events.location: OneMaker Group - OMG, 111 Middle Road, #01-02, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969
